meanings.definition: Capable of being indicated or referred to.
meanings.sent1: The bright red apple on the tree is denotable from afar.
meanings.sent2: The denotable landmarks helped us navigate through the city.
meanings.sent3: The denotable clown made everyone laugh with his silly antics.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter was denotable in the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The denotable smell of fresh cookies filled the kitchen.

meanings.definition: Able to be shown or pointed out.
meanings.sent1: The denotable signs along the trail guided us to the waterfall.
meanings.sent2: His denotable talent for painting was admired by all who saw his work.
meanings.sent3: The denotable cat chased after the elusive mouse in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The denotable stars in the night sky twinkled brightly above us.
meanings.sent5: The denotable joy on her face was evident to everyone at the party.
